name: Guoba
desc: Xiangling's friend, who inseparably accompanies her and helps with the cooking.

imgDesc.text: Guoba with friends: Xingqiu, Chongyun and Xiangling.

value.name: In Every House a Stove
value.desc:
In Every House a Stove

"The Stove God cared for the people, turning himself into minions who went into every home, fostering food and solidarity alike."

customize.text: Trailers and Story Teasers
Story Teaser: Flavors of the World

<color=#ffd780>October 2, 2021</color>
The passing of time is marked by meals as we drink and make merry, blessed by nature's grace. From past to present, the years go by in the blink of an eye. Smoke of hearths brings us joy and domesticity paints a picture of everyday life. Delicate clouds chase the moon as the boat floats on the river of time.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Fleeting Colors in Flight Event Cutscene Animation: "Age of Flowing Hues"

<color=#ffd780>January 31, 2022</color>
Blazing fireworks scatter across the sky like stars, welcoming prosperous times.
Their splendid colors and dazzling lights carry the countless wishes of the people, that the mountains and the moon retain their eternal beauty.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
The Exquisite Night Chimes Cutscene Animation: "A Brilliant Banquet of Music"

<color=#ffd780>January 21, 2023</color>
A new year brings with it new opportunities, dear friends, and good fortune.
On this night filled with a vibrant spectrum of lights, there's more than just lanterns in Liyue Harbor. Listen, for a brilliant resonance of celestial melodies rings in the air.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Gourmet Tour: "Liyue's Cuisine Collection" Issue No. 7

<color=#ffd780>February 26, 2024</color>
The flavors of food change over time, but the love for cooking remains the same from generation to generation.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Illustrations and Emojis
Xiangling's Birthday

<color=#ffd780>November 2, 2020</color>
Thanks for bringing those snacks — they look delicious!But... when it comes to birthday dishes, you've just got to make them yourself! I've made some super fresh Slime Cake. Come on, have a bite!
<color=#80c0ff>Twitter:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/twitter.com/GenshinImpact/status/1323218299807797248</color>
"Moonlight Merriment" Event

<color=#ffd780>August 30, 2021</color>
During the event, Travelers can complete quests in Moonchase Tales or take part in Moonlight Seeker and Trail of Delicacies challenges to obtain rewards such as the event-exclusive claymore, Luxurious Sea-Lord as well as its refinement materials, Crown of Insight, Primogems, recipes, and more.
Xiangling's Birthday

<color=#ffd780>November 2, 2021</color>
Whoa, all these ingredients are for me? Thank you!
Good thing I picked all these fresh apples. They're really sweet. Here, try some!
Let me check the ingredients. Hmmm... there's Fish, Jueyun Chili, and Violetgrass...
That's right, if you give me a moment, I'll make you my signature dish: Wanmin Restaurant's Boiled Fish!
I could use an extra hand, Guoba!
Xiangling's Birthday

<color=#ffd780>November 2, 2021</color>
"Xiangling, last time you said you were looking for new interesting ingredients, so we brought you a lot of new stuff... huh? Don't cry, what's wrong? Are you that touched?"
Lantern Rite 2022

<color=#ffd780>February 1, 2022</color>
Hurry Traveler, hang the Xiao Lantern and come and eat!
Paimon can't wait, the delicious meal prepared by Xiangling and Guoba smells amazing!
<color=#80c0ff>Twitter:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/twitter.com/GenshinImpact/status/1488361467447439360</color>
Xiangling's Birthday

<color=#ffd780>November 2, 2022</color>
"What should I make for lunch today...?"
"Huh? Guoba, look! There's so much food on the table!"
"How strange... Who could have cooked all these delicious dishes?"
Lunar New Year's Eve 2022

<color=#ffd780>January 31, 2022</color>
Here we go, piping hot dishes coming through!
Paimon must be hungry, right? But we have to wait for everyone to arrive before we can start eating!
<color=#80c0ff>Twitter:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/twitter.com/GenshinImpact/status/1488134976289845250</color>
Lantern Rite 2023

<color=#ffd780>January 27, 2023</color>
Just a while more! The last course is almost ready!
Hu Tao's Birthday

<color=#ffd780>July 15, 2023</color>
"♪ It's a fine day, and we're gonna eat MY way! ♪ Aha, you made it! This last dish will be prepared by no other than yours truly~ Bet you can't wait, eh?"
Xiangling's Birthday

<color=#ffd780>November 2, 2023</color>
"Beidou, could we go diving for some octopus from the Sea of Clouds? Turns out I'd really like some for my birthday after all..."
"Ahh, Xiangling! I wish you'd stop having such dangerous ideas...!"
Xiangling's Birthday

<color=#ffd780>November 2, 2023</color>
Knowing that you were coming, I got up early to prepare the ingredients and worked in the kitchen all morning.
This time I cooked everyone's favorite dishes! I remember all of your preferences, of course.
Check these out: Wanmin Restaurant's Boiled Fish, Golden Shrimp Balls, Noodles with Mountain Delicacies, Crystal Shrimp, and...
Oh! And Chili-Mince Cornbread Buns made by Guoba himself! Haven't had one of those myself in a long time!
New Year's 2024

<color=#ffd780>January 1, 2024</color>
"Like this...! And then like... this! What do you think Xiangling, have I gotten even better?"
"It's like the saying goes... 'Review the old to shed light on the new.' Maybe one day I'll be as mighty as Master!"
"Then I can't fall behind either! I'll have to find some special high-end ingredients to practice with."
"Alright, that's enough for now. Practicing spear fighting on an empty stomach simply will not do. Come on, it's time to eat."
Thanks to yu-ri for the fantastic artwork!
Liyue Character Emojis

<color=#ffd780>September 16, 2020</color>
<color=#80c0ff>Twitter:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/twitter.com/GenshinImpact/status/1306178713071972353</color>
Paimon's Paintings XXI

<color=#ffd780>January 20, 2023</color>
Greetings, Travelers! The latest emojis from Genshin Impact are now available on HoYoLAB~
Paimon's Paintings include a collection of chibi emojis of various Genshin Impact characters. We hope you like them! Paimon will continue to paint more cute emojis for everyone~

customize.name: Xiangling
customize.desc: A renowned chef from Liyue. She's extremely passionate about cooking and excels at making her signature hot and spicy dishes.

customize.text: Character Story

<color=#ffd780>Character Story 4</color>
Whenever a customer asks what exactly was the perplexing creature that follows Xiangling around is, she tells them the story:
There was a sudden downpour one day when Xiangling was on her way to fetch some Violetgrass. Halfway there, she was already tired and hungry. She stumbled into a cave, and came across a strange shrine.
So she sat down by the shrine, and took out two pieces of spicy cornbread.
She gobbled down one, but left the other one on the shrine, intending to eat a little later, but then promptly fell asleep.
When she woke up, the other spicy cornbread was gone and a mysterious creature was sitting in front of her, staring.
"Was it good?"
It nodded.
"More?" She took out some jerky from her backpack.
The mysterious creature nodded once again.
This was how Xiangling made a new friend. It seemed to be drawn to Xiangling's cooking, as the creature started following Xiangling around wherever she went.
Xiangling named it "Guoba," after her favorite childhood snack.

customize.name: Hu Tao
customize.desc: The 77th Director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. She took over the business at a rather young age.

customize.text: Voice-Overs

<color=#ffd780>About Xiangling</color>
Xiangling's a riot! Only a little "boo" and she jumps, she's so easy to scare! Being in the industry that I am, I just love these kinds of people the most. Gotta keep it in check though, in case Guoba ends up toasting me instead.

customize.name: Xianyun
customize.desc: One of the Mighty and Illuminated Adepti of Jueyun, known as "Cloud Retainer." Expert in all kinds of mechanical contraptions, her heart now turns towards the affairs of the mortal world, through which she walks under the name "Xianyun."

customize.text: Character Story

<color=#ffd780>Character Story 1</color>
Every second of every day, Liyue Harbor bustles with throngs of people coming and going. Local businessman weighed down by sacks of gold, outlanders garbed in strange attire, shrewd and canny public servants, warm-hearted guards... People from all walks of life with all sorts of personalities mingle, to the extent that no one looks out of place.
When someone new suddenly appears in a city like this, people don't bat an eyelid.
This particular newcomer to Liyue Harbor is a woman who goes by the name of Xianyun. Tall and slender, she wears a pair of red-rimmed spectacles and exudes an aura that makes her stand out from the crowd.
To the Fontainian merchants who sell their mechanical creations on the streets of Liyue, she's already a familiar figure. When passing by, she invariably stops to discuss mechanical design with them — and once such discussions get started, entire afternoons fly by before anyone notices. She seems well acquainted with Chef Mao and Xiangling from Wanmin Restaurant as well, and is often to be seen sitting at a table opposite Guoba, waiting for a bowl of piping hot Dragon Beard Noodles. And she's also made an impression on the waiters of both Xinyue Kiosk and Liuli Pavilion, where she sometimes dines as the guest of Mr. Zhongli from the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. Granny Shan, the toy seller, remembers her too. If memory serves, she'd tell you, Xianyun's the one who often brings along a young woman with long, white hair to look at her kites and other trinkets. The young woman, whose name she now recalls is Shenhe, never seems to find anything that takes her fancy — yet Xianyun always brings her back nonetheless.
Just like many other residents of Liyue Harbor, it seems that Xianyun not only has hobbies of her own, but also travels widely and has many friends.
So when people see her chatting with Madame Ping by the fish pond nearby Yujing Terrace, they think nothing of it.
"I haven't seen much of Mountain Shaper lately. And Moon Carver still hasn't returned that Multi-Purpose Abode Cleaning Talisman I lent him, to this day..."
"Is that so? What might that be then, some sort of new sigil contraption you've come up with?"
"Yes, let me tell you all about it..."
Each day, there comes a time when the lights of thousands of homes finally go out, and Liyue Harbor falls silent for a brief while. With nothing more to see before morning, Xianyun takes this opportunity to take a stroll along the narrow path that winds up Mt. Tianheng.
Jagged outcrops pose little obstacle for Xianyun. With a quick jump up and a gust of wind below, she's already at the top in the blink of an eye.
Gazing down upon the murky streets far below, the human known as Xianyun transforms into a crane, and with a flap of her wings lifts herself up toward the firmament.
But of course, there's really nothing strange about any of this. Liyue Harbor is a city that embraces all — so it's only natural that some adepti would end up living here too.
Relationships

customize.text: Marchosius's friends and other protectors of Liyue.
Moonchase Festival

The Moonchase Festival in Liyue is dedicated to the God of the Stove, Marchosius, and celebrates the arrival of the fall by moonlight. This festival is a time to meet with family and friends and enjoy good food. Each year, the Liyue Qixing holds the Masterful Chefs competition to honor the God of the Stove. During the Moonlight Merriment Event, the Traveler discovered that Guoba's secret identity is Marchosius. Although Guoba has retained much of Marchosius's knowledge, he has lost almost all memories of his past.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Moonchase Festival
customize.desc: The Moonchase Festival celebrates the arrival of the fall by moonlight.

customize.text: Guoba

Millennia ago, Guoba, or as he was known at that time, Marchosius, worked with Rex Lapis and
to rule the Guili Plains. There, he split himself into many smaller versions of himself in order to teach the people of Liyue how to make fires and cook food. In this way, he brought fire to every home.

Nevertheless, during the Archon War, the Guili Plains were flooded, and the residents were forced to travel to Liyue Harbor for safety and shelter. Rex Lapis and the other Adepti escorted the people to protect them from the terrible storm. Marchosius prepared flatbreads with a meat sauce to feed the people and provide warmth. Marchosius was once the Patron God of the Soil, all the wisdom and power he had, he has since surrendered to the soil itself to prevent the kinds of trials and tribulations that a land can face such as droughts, floods, torrential rain, hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, fires, and plagues. He once walked over the barren plains with people until arriving at last at the harbor. He joined humans in building their dwellings and lighting the stoves. It was his hand that lit the very first street lamp of Liyue and brought the aroma of cooked food into every household in the land.

Hundreds of years later, the world was again engulfed by disasters and plagues. Marchosius expended almost all of his divine powers to quell the calamities. In the end, his wits were greatly reduced, and his size was smaller than a human.

Marchosius left all his cooking knowledge and secrets of the flame to Rex Lapis and Streetward Rambler. Then he went into the mountains and entered a long slumber. He slept for several centuries until he woke up to the smell of Xiangling's Chili-Mince Cornbread Buns on his altar. He was so moved by the food that he decided to follow her. Xiangling named Guoba after her favorite food and he soon became a part of the family.
Although Guoba no longer has divine powers or is able to speak, he is still happy to see his Adepti friends: Streetward Rambler and Zhongli.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Archon War
customize.desc: The war for the divine thrones, declared by the Heavenly Principles. As a result of the Archon War that finished about 2000 years ago, seven rulers of seven nations received the Gnoses, the divine throne, and the title of an Archon.

customize.name: Adepti
customize.desc: Adepti are a group of immortal illuminated beasts of Liyue, who have protected people for millennia.

customize.name: Chili-Mince Cornbread Buns
customize.desc: A traditional snack from Liyue. The fresh dough is turned out into a round, rested, and then placed inside a cage to steam. The meat and vegetables are then washed and diced, before being fried quickly in an oiled wok. When eaten, the fried condiments must be placed into the empty space in the middle of the buns before they are eaten together. Between the crisp vegetables and the flavorful meat, this is solid, great flavor.
